meanings.definition: The state of being haggard or exhausted in appearance.
meanings.sent1: Her haggardnesses showed how tired she was after the long journey.
meanings.sent2: The actor's haggardnesses were evident after filming all night.
meanings.sent3: Despite her haggardnesses, she still managed to crack a smile.
meanings.sent4: The haggardnesses of the old house made it seem haunted.
meanings.sent5: The haggardnesses of the marathon runner's face revealed the grueling race.

meanings.definition: The quality of being wild or untamed.
meanings.sent1: The haggardnesses of the forest at night made it seem mysterious.
meanings.sent2: The lion's haggardnesses showed its untamed nature.
meanings.sent3: The haggardnesses of the puppy's playfulness delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The haggardnesses of the stormy sea mirrored the pirate's spirit.
meanings.sent5: The haggardnesses of the wild horse made it a challenge to tame.

meanings.definition: The condition of being worn or gaunt.
meanings.sent1: His haggardnesses were a result of not eating properly.
meanings.sent2: The prisoner's haggardnesses spoke of his harsh living conditions.
meanings.sent3: The haggardnesses of the old book made it look ancient.
meanings.sent4: The haggardnesses of the mountain range hinted at its age.
meanings.sent5: The haggardnesses of the scarecrow made it seem eerie in the moonlight.
